net.arhipov.equalsbuilder

Class EqualsBuilder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.arhipov.equalsbuilder.EqualsBuilder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - common supertype of objects being compared

    public class EqualsBuilder<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Compares two java objects comparing common superclass.

    EqualsBuilder allows you to compare objects using fluent builder pattern. Object fields are extracted using getter methods, which can conveniently be passed as reference methods in Java 8.

    The following example illustrates how EqualsBuilder might me used to compare complex class objects: 

    
  class Account {
      private String owner;
      private long balance;

      public String getOwner() { return owner; }
      public long getBalance() { return balance; }
  }
  class FinancialOperation {
      private int amount;
      private Account from;
      private Account to;

      public int getAmount { return amount; }
      public Account getFrom() { return from; }
      public Account getTo() { return from; }
  }
  class Payment {
      private int id;
      private List<FinancialOperation> financialOperations;

      public int getId() { return id; }
      public List<FinancialOperation> getFinancialOperations() { return financialOperations; }
  }

  EqualsBuilder.test(payment1, payment2)
      .comparing(Payment::getId)
      .comparingCollections(Payment::getFinancialOperations, (op1, op2) -> EqualsBuilder.test(op1, op2)
          .comparing(FinancialOperation::getAmount)
          .comparing(FinancialOperation::getFrom, (from1, from2) -> EqualsBuilder.test(from1, from2)
              .comparing(Account::getOwner)
              .comparing(Account::getBalance)
              .areEqual())
          .comparing(FinancialOperation::getTo, (to1, to2) -> EqualsBuilder.test(to1, to2)
              .comparing(Account::getOwner)
              .comparing(Account::getBalance)
              .areEqual())
          .areEqual())
      .areEqual();

    • Method Detail

      • test

        public static <T> EqualsBuilder<T> test(T a,
                                        java.lang.Object b)
        Creates a new EqualsBuilder instance for two objects. For objects to be equal, b should be the same type as a.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Class of first object.
        Parameters:
        a - Typed object to be compared
        b - Untyped object to be compared
        Returns:
        EqualsBuilder instance for T class

      • test

        public static <T,U extends T> EqualsBuilder<T> test(U a,
                                                    java.lang.Object b,
                                                    java.lang.Class<T> commonType)
        Creates a new EqualsBuilder instance for two objects sharing a common superclass.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Common superclass type. In most cases should be inferred.
        U - Actual class of first object.
        Parameters:
        a - Typed object to be compared
        b - Untyped object to be compared
        commonType - Common super class for both a and b objects
        Returns:
        EqualsBuilder instance for T class

      • comparing

        public EqualsBuilder<T> comparing(java.util.function.Function<T,?> getter)
        Compare objects fields using getter.
        Parameters:
        getter - a method applied to both objects to extract field (usually getter)
        Returns:
        EqualsBuilder instance

      • comparing

        public <R> EqualsBuilder<T> comparing(java.util.function.Function<T,R> getter,
                                      java.util.function.BiPredicate<R,R> equalizer)
        Compare objects fields using getter and a defined comparing function. This method might be used to compare objects for equality deeply.

        Deep comparison example: 

        
 EqualsBuilder.test(first, second)
     .comparing(MyClass::getInnerObject, (a, b) -> EqualsBuilder.test(a, b)
         .comparing(InnerClass::getFirstField)
         .areEqual())
     .areEqual();
        Type Parameters:
        R - a type of the extracted field
        Parameters:
        getter - a method applied to both objects to extract field (usually getter)
        equalizer - a method used to compare two objects
        Returns:
        EqualsBuilder instance

      • comparingCollections

        public <R> EqualsBuilder<T> comparingCollections(java.util.function.Function<T,java.util.Collection<R>> getter,
                                                 java.util.function.BiPredicate<R,R> equalizer)
        Compares two collections of the same generic type extracted from objects with getter using provided BiPredicate collections elements with each other. This method should only be used for collections, where elements have order, such as List. Thus this method is not suitable for comparing sets.

        Example: 

        
 EqualsBuilder.test(first, second)
     .comparingCollections(MyClass::getList, (a, b) -> EqualsBuilder.test(a, b)
         .comparing(CollectionElement::getFirstField)
         .areEqual())
     .areEqual();
        Type Parameters:
        R - a collection elements type
        Parameters:
        getter - a method applied to both objects to extract collections (usually getter)
        equalizer - a method used to compare two collection elements
        Returns:
        EqualsBuilder instance

      • comparingIterables

        public <R> EqualsBuilder<T> comparingIterables(java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.Iterable<R>> getter,
                                               java.util.function.BiPredicate<R,R> equalizer)
        Compares two iterables of the same generic type extracted from objects with getter using provided BiPredicate collections elements with each other. For iterables that also implement Collection interface using comparingCollections(Function, BiPredicate) method is prefered.

        Example: 

        
 EqualsBuilder.test(first, second)
     .comparingIterables(MyClass::getIterable, (a, b) -> EqualsBuilder.test(a, b)
         .comparing(iterableElement::getFirstField)
         .areEqual())
     .areEqual();
        Type Parameters:
        R - an iterable elements type
        Parameters:
        getter - a method applied to both objects to extract iterables (usually getter)
        equalizer - a method used to compare two iterable elements
        Returns:
        EqualsBuilder instance

      • comparingMaps

        public <K,R> EqualsBuilder<T> comparingMaps(java.util.function.Function<T,java.util.Map<K,R>> getter,
                                            java.util.function.BiPredicate<R,R> equalizer)
        Compares two maps extracted with a getter by their values using provided equality checking function. For values to be compared correctly, keys should be equal (override equals and hashCode methods correctly).

        Example: 

        
 class PaymentHistory {
     private Map<String, Payment> paymentIndex;
 }

 EqualsBuilder.test(history1, history2)
     .comparingMaps(PaymentHistory::getPaymentIndex, (a, b) -> EqualsBuilder.test(a, b)
         .comparing(Payment::getAmount)
         .comparing(Payment::getAccountFrom)
         .comparing(Payment::getAccountTo)
         .areEqual())
     .areEqual();
        Type Parameters:
        K - a key type that is the same for both maps
        R - a value type for both maps
        Parameters:
        getter - a method used to extract a map (usually a getter)
        equalizer - a method used to compare two map elements (values only)
        Returns:
        EqualsBuilder instance

      • areEqual

        public boolean areEqual()
        Returns true if either objects are considered equal and false otherwise. Objects are equal if they actually are references to the same object, both object are null, or for each comparing(Function) call, extracted objects and primitives where also considered equal.
        Returns:
        true if objects are equal and false otherwise
